meanings.definition: A person used by others for their own purposes.
meanings.sent1: In the game of chess, pawns are the small pieces that can be sacrificed for a greater strategy.
meanings.sent2: The villain saw the innocent bystander as a mere pawn in his evil plan.
meanings.sent3: The pawns in the office gossip were always the last to know the truth.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a pawn in the hands of fate, unable to control her own destiny.
meanings.sent5: Being treated like a pawn made him realize he needed to stand up for himself.

meanings.definition: To deposit as security, as for money borrowed.
meanings.sent1: He decided to pawn his watch to get some quick cash.
meanings.sent2: When times were tough, she would often pawn her jewelry for extra money.
meanings.sent3: The broke student had to pawn his laptop to pay for his rent.
meanings.sent4: She felt a pang of regret as she pawned her grandmother's ring for some temporary relief.
meanings.sent5: Desperate for money, he had no choice but to pawn his guitar, his most prized possession.

meanings.definition: To put forward as a pledge.
meanings.sent1: She had to pawn her engagement ring to secure the loan.
meanings.sent2: In order to get the loan approved, he had to pawn his car title.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would pawn his soul for a chance to win the lottery.
meanings.sent4: The young couple decided to pawn their savings as collateral for the business loan.
meanings.sent5: As a last resort, she had to pawn her family heirloom to cover the medical expenses.
